1.title: Russia - Saudi Arabia
1.plot: Russia faces Saudi Arabia in the opening match of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

2.title: Egypt - Uruguay
2.plot: Egypt and Uruguay play the second match of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, trying to start with a victory.

3.title: Morocco - Iran
3.plot: Morocco and Iran face each other in a must win match as they make their debut in the 2018 FIFA World Cup Match.

4.title: Portugal - Spain
4.plot: Portugal and Spain play their first game at the 2018 FIFA World Cup, the match is the face-off with the highest ranked teams in all the first round.

5.title: France - Australia
5.plot: France and Australia open the activity of Group C in the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

6.title: Argentina - Iceland
6.plot: Iceland becomes the smaller country to participate in a FIFA World Cup after playing their first match in history against Argentina.

7.title: Peru - Denmark
7.plot: Peru returns to a FIFA World Cup after a long 36 years absence to play against Denmark in Group C.

8.title: Croatia - Nigeria
8.plot: Croatia and Nigeria make their debuts at the 2018 FIFA World Cup looking for an important victory to start their campaigns.

9.title: Costa Rica - Serbia
9.plot: Serbia and Costa Rica face each other in the opening match of the Group E in the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

10.title: Germany - Mexico
10.plot: Germany, the champions of the last FIFA World Cup, start their campaign to defend their title against Mexico the strongest North American team.

11.title: Brazil - Switzerland
11.plot: Brazil is considered one of the favorite teams to win the 2018 FIFA World Cup and their first challenge comes in this match where they face Switzerland.

12.title: Sweden - Korea Republic
12.plot: After Germany surprising defeat with Mexico, Korea and Sweden, the other teams of Group F of the 2018 FIFA World Cup face each other knowing they are forced to get a victory.

13.title: Belgium - Panama
13.plot: Panama play their first match ever in World Cup history facing Belgium, the first seeded team in Group G of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

14.title: Tunisia - England
14.plot: Tunisia and England face each other as they play their first game at the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia.

15.title: Colombia - Japan
15.plot: Colombia and Japan play each other in the opening of Group H of the 2018 FIFA World Cup four years after playing against each other in Brazil 2014.

16.title: Poland - Senegal
16.plot: Poland and Senegal are the last two teams to make their presentation at the 2018 FIFA World Cup in a key match of the unpredictable Group H.

17.title: Russia - Egypt
17.plot: Russia and Egypt open the second match day in the Group A of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, after a victory in their debut Russia is looking to advance, while Egypt are in need of a first win.

18.title: Portugal - Morocco
18.plot: After starting their campaign with a heartbreaking defeat, Morocco needs to get points from Portugal, who are looking for a first victory after an enjoyable tie with Spain.

19.title: Uruguay - Saudi Arabia
19.plot: Uruguay faces Saudi Arabia as overwhelming favorites in a match where a victory for the South Americans will mean an elimination for both Arabia and Egypt.

20.title: Iran - Spain
20.plot: After a surprising victory in their first match, Iran need to show what are they made off as they face a Spain eager to get their first victory at the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

21.title: Denmark - Australia
21.plot: Denmark is looking for a second World Cup victory against Australia who started their campaign with a narrow defeat against France.

22.title: France - Peru
22.plot: Despite giving a good game, Peru lost in their debut and now are forced to get at least a point against France in order to avoid elimination from the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

23.title: Argentina - Croatia
23.plot: In one of the most expected matches of Group D, Argentina is looking for a first win against Croatia, that qualifies to the knockout stage with a victory.

24.title: Brazil - Costa Rica
24.plot: A showdown with Latin American teams that failed to score victories in their first games, will have Brazil and Costa Rica trying to earn more points to better their standing at Group E.

25.title: Nigeria - Iceland
25.plot: After Croatia victory over Argentina, Iceland and Nigeria face each other knowing they need a victory in order to be in the best position to advance to the knockout stage in the last match day.

26.title: Serbia - Switzerland
26.plot: Since before the start of the World Cup, Serbia and Switzerland now their match was essential for their chances of winning Group E, now its time to play between them and get three points that may probe definite for their fates.

27.title: Belgium - Tunisia
27.plot: After an easy victory over Panama, Belgium faces Tunisia looking for a victory that puts them in the knockout stages.

28.title: Korea Republic - Mexico
28.plot: Mexico obtained a fantastic victory in their debut match against Germany and are now looking to strength their position against a Korea team in urgent need of points.

29.title: Germany - Sweden
29.plot: Their defeat against Mexico sent shocks to the German team that now needs to get a victory over Sweden in order to avoid early elimination, the Scandinavian team knows taking points from their opponents will almost guarantee a knockout round participation.

30.title: England - Panama
30.plot: England knows a victory will qualify them to the knockout stages, Panama knows a defeat will eliminate them, and Belgium and Tunisia's fate is on the line in the fourth match of the 2018 FIFA World Cup Group G.

31.title: Japan - Senegal
31.plot: Both Senegal and Japan started their World Cup campaign with surprising victories, know they play against each other knowing a second win will certainly put them in the next round of the FIFA World Cup.

32.title: Poland - Colombia
32.plot: They were both favorites to win their group at the 2018 FIFA World Cup, but now Poland and Colombia are fighting for their lives and the loser of the match will be eliminated.

33.title: Uruguay - Russia
33.plot: Both Uruguay and Russia have qualified from Group A to the knockout stages of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, and will play each other for the first place in this match.

34.title: Saudi Arabia - Egypt
34.plot: After disappointing eliminations, Saudi Arabia and Egypt will face each other in their last match of the 2018 FIFA World Cup looking for something rare for both of them, a victory.

35.title: Spain - Morocco
35.plot: They played good football but got no points, now an eliminated Morocco will look for a good ending against Spain that are trying to win Group B of the World Cup.

36.title: Iran - Portugal
36.plot: Portugal and Iran play in a difficult match as both are looking for qualification to the knockout stages as both keep an eye on Spain result against Morocco.

37.title: Australia - Peru
37.plot: Peru are eliminated and simply look for a victory in their last match of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, while Australia needs to win in order to advance from the first round.

38.title: Denmark - France
38.plot: France is qualified, Denmark needs only one point to advance to the knockout stages, a tie will benefit both and eliminate Australia, but both teams won't dare to agree on a tie to bore the spectators or will they?

39.title: Nigeria - Argentina
39.plot: Argentina is desperate, they are close to elimination and only a victory over Nigeria will keep them alive. The Africans have lost to the South Americans in four previous meetings, will they change their luck?

40.title: Iceland - Croatia
40.plot: Croatia has never finish a Wolrd Cup group stage with three wins, and are looking to do it against Iceland, who took their undefeated record in the qualifiers and need another victory to advance.

41.title: Korea Republic - Germany
41.plot: Any kind of victory will see Germany in the knockout stages, they have never lost against a team from Asia and they are favorites against Korea, seeing the Asians wins seems like a miracle, will it happen?

42.title: Mexico - Sweden
42.plot: Mexico is the only team with six points that has not qualified to the knockout stages, any defeat against Sweden could cost them elimination if Germany also defeat Korea, the European team is forced to win in a tense match with everything to play for.

43.title: Serbia - Brazil
43.plot: Their defeat against Switzerland forces Serbia to beat Brazil if they are to advance to the knockout stages, the South Americans have not been convincing so far and are looking for a win that shows all their might.

44.title: Switzerland - Costa Rica
44.plot: Switzerland needs at least a tie to advance to the knockout stages, Costa Rica is eliminated but they are looking to score and avoid becoming the only team finishing the FIFA World Cup without a goal.

45.title: Japan - Poland
45.plot: After their early elimination, Poland became one of the big disappointments of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, they will try to finish with honor against Japan, who need at least a tie to earn a surprising qualification.

46.title: Senegal - Colombia
46.plot: Colombia and Senegal face in a win or die match looking for qualification to the knockout stages of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

47.title: Panama - Tunisia
47.plot: Both Tunisia and Panama are eliminated and they close their participation looking for a victory, it would be the first in Panama's history and the second for Tunisia who has not won since facing another American team, Mexico, in 1978.

48.title: England - Belgium
48.plot: With both teams qualified, England and Belgium give a chance to their bench players to play in this Wrold Cup as they start planning their knockout stage participation.

49.title: France - Argentina
49.plot: The first match of the knockout stage of the 2018 FIFA World Cup is the only match involving two former world champions.

50.title: Uruguay - Portugal
50.plot: European champions, Portugal and Uruguay who has not conceded a single goal at the 2018 FIFA World Cup face each other for a place in the last eight of the tournament.

51.title: Spain - Russia
51.plot: Russia plays the first knockout game in their history as an independent country, but they face Spain, one of the favorites to win the tournament.

52.title: Croatia - Denmark
52.plot: Croatia and Denmark play for a place in the final eight of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

53.title: Brazil - Mexico
53.plot: Brazil and Mexico face for the first time in history in knockout stages, Mexico has not been able to win this match in six consecutive attempts.

54.title: Belgium - Japan
54.plot: Belgium faces, in theory, the weakest team in the knockout stages, but Japan has nothing to lose and will try to manage a surprising victory.

55.title: Sweden - Switzerland
55.plot: Sweden and Switzerland have never faced each other in a FIFA World Cup and in this match they will have the chance of reaching the top 8 teams, a rare feat for both of them.

56.title: Colombia - England
56.plot: England and Colombia face in what is expected to be one of the tightest matches in the knockout stages of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

57.title: Uruguay - France
57.plot: France faces the second South American team and the second former world champion in a row as they try to reach the semifinals of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, while Uruguay is a victory away from a record of five straight victories.

58.title: Brazil - Belgium
58.plot: Belgium and Brazil play for a place in the semifinals of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

59.title: Russia - Croatia
59.plot: After their surprise victory over Spain, Russia faces Croatia for a place in the semifinals of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

60.title: Sweden - England
60.plot: Neither Sweden nor England have been able to play the semifinals of the FIFA World Cup since the 1990's, one of them will do it in Russia 2018.

61.title: France - Belgium
61.plot: France is aiming for their first World Cup Final since 2006, Belgium will try to reach the last match for the first time in history as both neighbors play the first semifinal of Russia 2018.

62.title: Croatia - England
62.plot: Croatia and England face each other in the last semifinal of the 2018 FIFA World Cup for a rare opportunity to play in the final match. England has not reached the last match since 1966, Croatia has never done it before.

63.title: Belgium - England
63.plot: After being defeated in the semifinals, England and Belgium meet for the second time in the 2018 FIFA World Cup, now with the third place of the competition at stake, for both winning would mean their best tournament in decades.

64.title: France - Croatia
64.plot: France and Croatia have become the last two teams in contention for the 2018 FIFA World Cup, after one month and six matches they will face each other in the final match, that will crown the best team of Football.

imdb.plot outline: The 21st FIFA World Cup, held in Russia, a quadrennial international football tournament contested by the men's national teams of the member associations of FIFA.
imdb.title: 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia

distributors.name: Arbeitsgemeinschaft der öffentlich-rechtlichen Rundfunkanstalten der Bundesrepublik Deutschland (ARD)

plot: The 21st FIFA World Cup, held in Russia, a quadrennial international football tournament contested by the men's national teams of the member associations of FIFA.::Manuel Valentín-Fernández

The 2018 FIFA World Cup was the 21st FIFA World Cup, an international football tournament contested by the men's national teams of the member associations of FIFA once every four years. It took place in Russian Federation from 14 June to 15 July 2018. It was the first World Cup to be held in Eastern Europe, and the 11th time that it had been held in Europe. At an estimated cost of over $14.2 billion, it was the most expensive World Cup ever. It was also the first World Cup to use the video assistant referee (VAR) system.::Peter-Patrick76 (peter-patrick@mail.com)

The 2018 FIFA World Cup was the 21st FIFA World Cup, an international football tournament contested by the men's national teams of the member associations of FIFA once every four years. It took place in Russia from 14 June to 15 July 2018. It was the first World Cup to be held in Eastern Europe, and the 11th time that it had been held in Europe. At an estimated cost of over $14.2 billion, it was the most expensive World Cup. It was also the first World Cup to use the video assistant referee (VAR) system. The finals involved 32 teams, of which 31 came through qualifying competitions, while the host nation qualified automatically. Of the 32 teams, 20 had also appeared in the previous tournament in 2014, while both Iceland and Panama made their first appearances at a FIFA World Cup. A total of 64 matches were played in 12 venues across 11 cities. The final took place on 15 July at the Luzhniki Stadium in Moscow, between France and Croatia. France won the match 4-2 to claim their second World Cup title, marking the fourth consecutive title won by a European team.::ahmetkozan
